result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Alexander Hicks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *The Court orders the defendant to submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  The Court orders the defendant to pay all applicable mandatory cost, surcharges, fees, and assessments within 6 months (by 5-16-16).  Any remaining balance to covert to civil judgment.
*Huber release for employment only; NO ELECTRONIC MONITORING.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Alexander Hicks

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph Alexander Hicks in court with Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  
Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Sentencing.  Defendant found guilty of COUNT 1: DISORDERLY CONDUCT (WITHOUT PENALTY ENHANCER) after jury trial.  Case passed to see if ADA Daniel Gabler available as he appeared on behalf of the state at trial.  

CASE RECALLED.....SAME APPEARANCES.....

Attorney Gabler not available.  Hearing proceeded.  Statements made by the state, defense, and defendant.  Additional statement made by Davina S.

The Court orders the defendant to serve 80 DAYS in the House of Corrections with 2 days of credit for time served.  Huber release for employment only; NO ELECTRONIC MONITORING.  The Court orders the defendant to submit dna sample and pay surcharge.  The Court orders the defendant to pay all applicable mandatory cost, surcharges, fees, and assessments within 6 months (by 5-16-16).  Any remaining balance to covert to civil judgment. Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
D279A
cf

Defendant Joseph Alexander Hicks in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Jurors back for continued deliberations.  At 9:35 am the parties addressed a jury question.  At 10:00 am the parties addressed a jury question.  At 11:07 am the parties addresse a jury question.  At the hour of 11:31 am the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY as to DISORDERLY CONDUCT; and when asked:  Did the defendant commit the crime of Disorderly Conduct while possessing a dangerous weapon?; the jury circled NO,  which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 24.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joseph Alexander Hicks in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin and student intern Lauren Maddente.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Jury in box at 1:40 pm.  Back on the stand for juror questions:  Joseph Hicks.  State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Jury out of box at 1:57 pm.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 2:44 pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff Deputy  Ray Crespo who was duly sworn for that purpose.  Jury brought into court at 4:46 pm and dismissed for th date.  Court ordered case adjourned for continued jury trial on October 21, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 24.

Defendant Joseph Alexander Hicks in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin and student intern Lauren Maddente.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Jury panel in court at 8:40 am.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Jeffrey R.  Jury out of box at 9:41 am.  Jury in box at 9:58 am.  Sworn for the state:  Kris M. and Officer Derek Martinez - MPD.  Exhibits 1-5 received.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box at 10:51 am.  Defense motion to dismiss.  Court had colloquy with defendant abouat his right to/not to testify.  Court finds the defendant knowingly, intelligently waives his right to remain silent.  The defendant will testify on his own behalf.  Jury in the box  at 11:07 am.  Sworn for defense:  Joseph Hicks.  Case adjourned until 1:30 pm.  Jury released at 11:46 am.

Defendant Joseph Alexander Hicks in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin with student intern Lauren Maddente.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  03:14 pm.  Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Jury out of box at 4:27 pm.  Jury in box at 4:38 pm.  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 24.  Jury out of box at 4:42 pm.  In chambers discussions put on the record.  Jury scheduled on October 20, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 24.

Defendant Joseph Alexander Hicks in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case remains in trial posture.  Case passed until 1:30 pm.

Defendant Joseph Alexander Hicks in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case remains in trial posture.  Case passed.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant has not checked in yet.  The State is ready to proceed - victim, witness and police officer are present in court.  Case passed.

Defendant Joseph Alexander Hicks in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.  Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing.
For reasons stated on the record, Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 24.  Jury trial scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joseph Alexander Hicks in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joseph Alexander Hicks in court.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Attorney Alexis Stewart is no longer with the Public Defender's office.  Case needs to be adjourned so that counbsel can be appointed.  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 24.  Clerk notified the Public Defender's office of the new date.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Joseph Alexander Hicks in court with attorney Joan E. Zawikowski.  Defendant Joseph Alexander Hicks in custody.  
Gale G Shelton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  

DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 150.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Joseph Alexander Hicks not in court.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.

Defendant Joseph Alexander Hicks not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant's mother called on 6-09-2015, at 3:00 pm. informing the court that her son was picked up by the Sheriff's department and taken to Behavior Health. She is not sure when he will be released. I scheduled the next court date for Tuesday 6-16-2015 at 1:30 pm. I also informed her to call the court if he is not released by then and we will have to talk to the Commissioner on how to handle this situtation. Also she was informed to have her son bring in the paperwork when he comes in for his next court appearance.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 6/10/15 @ 1:30 pm

Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04/22/2015
